events.title: Start of the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia
events.description: The Constitutional Convention began in Philadelphia, where delegates drafted the United States Constitution.
events.significance: This event laid the foundation for the U.S. government and its laws, shaping the country's future.

events.title: Live Aid Concerts Held Worldwide
events.description: Simultaneous benefit concerts took place in London and Philadelphia to raise funds for famine relief in Ethiopia.
events.significance: Live Aid raised awareness and millions of dollars for famine relief, marking a landmark in global charity efforts and music history.

events.title: First Color Television Broadcast in the United States
events.description: CBS made the first commercial color television broadcast in the U.S., showcasing the event 'Premiere.'
events.significance: This marked a revolutionary advancement in television technology, influencing entertainment and media.

events.title: Battle of the Spurs
events.description: During the Italian Wars, Charles V's forces defeated the French near Guinegate, France.
events.significance: This victory bolstered Charles V's power in Europe during a period of intense territorial conflicts.

events.title: Assassination of Nazi Leader Reinhard Heydrich
events.description: Reinhard Heydrich, a high-ranking Nazi official, was mortally wounded by Czechoslovak resistance fighters in Prague.
events.significance: This assassination was a significant act of resistance against Nazi occupation and had major repercussions during WWII.
